18227974.review:
Captures the feel of being the most known fictional detectives in history and lets you feel like you are investigating, deducing and solving a series of crimes with style and finess. Interesting, fun, sometimes challenging in areas and even though it is not perfect, Crimes and Punishment is a good puzzle/detective game.

:Spoiler alert:
If you like the sound of this so far and plan to buy it, do NOT read the next bit as it contains spoilers which may spoil your enjoyment completely. What I would say is never check your results until the very end of the game.

Spoiler:
[spoiler]The crimes do not have an incorrect answer. Each possibility is 'correct' as if you pick it, even if the game decides it is not the 'true' correct answer, the accused culprit admits everything, the evidence all checks out and everything plays out as if you were correct... all except for that small note if you check your decision which says "oops, this wasn't the TRUE correct answer, but good job anyway". This kinda spoils it for me and I stopped playing once I had one of these messages. If the game said "whoops! You had a good theory, but it was wrong and some things didn't quite check out which affected Sherlocks reputation and therefore your end score"... THAT would be acceptable. Villains admitting doing things that the game says is wrong just makes it feel like it's trying to make you win regardless of what you do, which turns this into a rail-puzzler. Solve the pre-set puzzles, pick whichever answer you like and BAM! Job done.[/spoiler]

Overall, good. Recommended for anyone who will never check their score until the end or someone who loves this kind of game! :D

18222922.review:
This is, without a shadow of a doubt, my favourite Sherlock Holmes game yet. The deduction system which allows for multiple conclusions gives the game great depth in comparison to the previous installations. Another interesting feature is the ability to read people by freezing time and studying details about clothing, expressions and appearance which gives unique dialogue options. 

Additionally, the graphics allow for fantastic immersion and clearer view of the objects around you, which makes clue-finding more natural. This is something that always bugged me in the older Sherlock games (I still have nightmares about Mystery of the Mummy). The voice acting is a lot better this time around, but it's nothing exceptional.

The only issue I have with Crimes and Punishments is its longevity, as a full completion of the game clocks at about 15 hours if played slowly, with a total of 6 great cases of varied difficulty. 

Would I like to play more? Yes. Is it still worth the money? Definitely yes.

18209408.review:
Everything about this game is fantastic except for the arbitrary nature of the deduction system. There will typically be at least three solutions with separate suspects and different means of having committed the crime. The different clues which have been collected during the investigation must be arranged to form different deductions in order to single out the perpetrator. The system is genius except for the fact, that the developers have failed to make some deductions more correct or coherent than others. Thus you can never be sure your chosen solution - based on solid reasoning (what Sherlock Holmes is supposed to be all about!) - will be correct. Even if you have taken all things into considerations and logically chosen the most likely explanation. This have been incredibly frustrating and immersion breaking. 

To further explain what I mean by the solution being arbitrary, I will provide the following observation:
Any case in  "Crimes & Punishments" will have established means, motives and opportunities for all suspects, if you diligently have found all the different clues. The problem as I see it is, that there should at least be some few things that makes one suspect more likely than the other, or deductions that stood out as far less sound, as they appeared to be in conflict with other circumstances like causality or the existence of contradictory evidence, but no. All the solutions are equal in likelihood and reasoning, and as Sherlock Holmes we are bound to make a decision on who we would most wish to see having committed the crime or who we intuitively believe did the crime based on knowledge of crime cliches. 
It seams the developers have constructed the clues, deductions and solutions in order to  fit the model of "means, motives and opportunities" as conditions in order to establish guilt as found in common law legal systems. This still only provides a dissatisfying experience, as this doesn't prove the actual guilt of the suspect, which in turn today nor in Victorian era Britain were enough to lift the needed burden of prof of having committed a crime. Establishing the presence of these three elements is not, in and of itself, sufficient to provide a conviction beyond reasonable doubt; the evidence must prove that an opportunity presented was indeed taken by the suspect and for the crime with which he or she is charged. In "Crimes & Punishments" the different solutions are entirely equal in probability, and this is the prime weakness of the system: If all the suspects can be reasoned to be equally as likely the ones who committed the crime, then they are all equally as unlikely to be guilty, and in a court of law this would actually make providing a conviction impossible. The conclusion simply  cannot be proven beyond a reasonable doubt. 

It frustrates and saddens me, that the deduction system have been built in such a way as the solutions are wholly arbitrary and in total disconnect with the books of sir Arthur Conan Doyle. Mainly because if you can ignore this, then the game is fantastic. The atmosphere is fantastic and the locations and voice acting is great.

18165619.review:
Simply put, Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments is one of the finer adventure/crime solving games I've played. The writing is excellent, and each case will intrigue. The lack of a coherent overarching storyline is a tad disappointing, but that's simply not the focus of the game. It follows Sherlock Holmes doing what he does best - solving crimes and administering punishments.

The atmosphere and overall presentation are quite on point as well. Some of the animation can be stiff, but the overall attention to detail is commendable nonetheless. If someone has a limp, you can guarantee that they'll actually walk with a limp in the game. The texture and general location quality is also of note. While the game isn't taxing by any means, it looks gorgeous cranked up to maximum settings with detailed recreations of Ye Olde London. There isn't much music, but it's used to good effect when it pops up, and helps set a much darker tone and feeling than most Sherlock Holmes properties.

Finally, the detective and puzzle gameplay itself. It's quite good! The puzzles never become extraordinarily difficult, but they strike a nice balance between needing actual thought and not being so complex as to slow down the pace of the story. There's good variety here, as well, with a number of small, mini-game esque challenges to beat (though they can be skipped if that's not your thing), interrogations, autopsies, crime reconstructions and even a few notable sequences of trying to rebuild the sequence of events in Holmes' imagination. You won't need a membership in Mensa to make progress here, but it will challenge just enough to make you feel like Sherlock Holmes himself. Ultimately, given that the game has his name on it, that's probably the biggest praise I can give this.

18091693.review:
Curieuse perplexité après avoir terminé ce "Crimes & Punishments"...
Pour avoir fait un autre S.Holmes avant celui ci, je dirai que l'orientation prise par ce nouvel épisode désoriente un peu, et je vais donc commencer par expliquer pourquoi.

Ici, on vous propose une suite de plusieurs petites enquêtes sans relation entre elles (pas de souci avec ça). Mais d'une enquête à l'autre, la courbe de difficulté est … étrangement inexistante. La seule chose qui se complexifie un tant soit peu visiblement au fil de la progression, c'est le crochetage des serrures.
Pour un jeu d'aventure/enquête, les joueurs sont abusivement pris par la main pour absolument [u]tout[/u], et la seule fois où je me suis retrouvée bloquée une dizaine de minutes était bêtement lié à un problème d'interface qui n'avait rien à voir avec l'investigation.
Donc si vous connaissez la série, ayez à l'esprit que les développeurs du jeu semblent clairement avoir changé de cible - et s'adressent désormais soit à un public beaucoup plus enfantin, soit beaucoup plus "limité" intellectuellement. [i](Je pense que la seconde option est la bonne, car le jeu serait facilement plié par un enfant à mon humble avis).[/i]

Mais au delà de ça, jusqu'à quel point les développeurs de chez [i]Frogwares[/i] s'aventurent t'ils à nous prendre pour des cons demanderez vous? Eh bien c'est là que c'est déconcertant : Son excellence technique dénote carrément avec cet inquiétant [i]non-gameplay[/i] consistant tout le long à du [i]"press A to win"[/i].

Et cette [i]forme[/i] indéniablement réussie n'est qui plus est pas dénuée de [i]fond[/i]!
[list]
    [*]Le jeu est très joli, il tourne bien, le doublage des personnages est très correct, la traduction est impeccable, l'interface est fonctionnelle au pad comme à la souris, et même si le jeu est parfois un peu "cucul", certains scénars sont plutôt bien ficelés... 
Le jeu est franchement plaisant et agréable à parcourir.

    [*]Crimes & Punishments propose un système de déductions / conclusions en fonction des indices récoltés. Le principe est assez sympa et intéressant, puisque on peut faire ses propres déductions logiques en fonction des indices, qui amèneront généralement à une conclusion.
Mais le jeu a le bon goût d'autoriser le joueur à partir dans la mauvaise direction et même d'arriver à de [i]mauvaises conclusions[/i]. et il est donc possible de classer une affaire sans avoir véritablement saisi ce qui est réellement arrivé, ou (pire) en ayant appréhendé et condamné le mauvais suspect ! J'aime beaucoup ce principe.

    [*]Autre nouveauté, la possibilité de condamner ou d'absoudre votre coupable une fois que vous en avez dégotté un. Très appréciable quand on a une certaine empathie pour le ou la criminel(le) dont le geste semble plus ou moins justifié.

    [*]Les mini-jeux sont tellement bien intégrés à la trame scénarisée qu'exception faite des crochetages, je n'ai quasiment jamais eu vraiment conscience d'en faire un... Est ce une qualité ou un défaut ? Un peu les deux je crois pour ma part. 
[/list]
En plus de ma remarque introductive, je formulerai d'autres petits regrets pas bien méchants :[list]

    [*]Les temps de chargement entre les zones qui peuvent vite se multiplier dans certaines situations où le jeu vous fait faire un ping-pong absurde entre deux zones.

    [*]Les portraits des personnages (obtenus en les observant) n'ont pas d'utilité particulière dans l'enquête et semblent même facultatifs à débloquer, alors que l'idée et le principe auraient pu être sympas à intégrer aux enquêtes. Dommage. 

    [*]Ce pauvre Watson est toujours aussi boulet... Même le chien Tobby a un peu plus de caractère.[/list]

18086594.review:
I really enjoyed 'Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments'. While the acting and the writing may be seem a bit dry at first, the characters and the cheesy 'funny' moments do grow on you over time. The game also looks really good, with very detailed environments and characters.

The gameplay feels more like a CSI show where you talk to people and look for clues, and the game (usually via Holmes' expositions) will tell you what to do, or explain what was really happening the entire time. It's really hard to make the player feel like they solved the game through their own wits, and this game like many others falls short in that regard, but I still enjoyed the procedural gameplay, the quirky cases, and the colourful characters.

18019472.review:
An interesting and enjoyable, if a bit rough, investigation game that actually allows you to do the investigation, rather then following the scripted sequence. 

Environments and characters are beautiful and rich, while still holding quite firmly to their setting. the suspect profile mechanic is well suited to the game and shows off the obvious care that has been put into both in the polygons and in the planning. So well constructed are the models that it comes as a shock when Sherlock's pet basset hound, Toby, is added as a mechanic in later cases and is modelled somewhat inexpertly, leaving him with a model that is merely good among a cast of great.

The "deduction" system that acts as part hint system, part progress meter and part inventory system for clues is a unique addition to the genera. It's fortunately flexible enough to allow you to follow the case in your own route, revealing enough information to grease the mechanics, without washing away all the challenge. 

The imagination system is a rich concept that is tragically underutilized. This unique mechanic allows Sherlock to simulate events and see how they would fit the facts. The 2 or 3 times it's used to it's fullest effect, it's dead-on in terms of tone, style and function, but it's often not utilized, utilized only minimally, or outright replaced by other, similar, less well polished mechanics. 

suffers a little bit from adventure game syndrome, but a lot less than many other games; there were only 3 places where I felt a puzzle was contrived for progress reasons or arbitrarily gated, and most of those could have been easily lamp-shaded away with some dialogue exposing the in-universe explanation.  The path based lock-picking mechanic is a bit weird, but it's nice to have something other then literal bumping or rotational hotspot systems, and it works with the narrative of Sherlock "deducting" the lock open.

There are some technical issues as well. One puzzle was simply impossible to complete due to a crash to desktop, and I’ve seen reports of others seeing similar issues with other puzzles. Fortunately, these aren't game-blocking, thanks to the developers including a no-guilt skip button on nearly every puzzle, acting as a pressure valve on frustrating puzzles (and the rare crashy sequence). 

the major complaint that I have is that there is clearly a "right" answer to every case, but the cases are structured so many of the different solutions fit just as tightly. the discovery of the "right" solution in some of the cases is partially trial and error, and partially jumping on the train of thought of the designer; in one case, quite literally. I often felt less like a masterful Sherlock, and more bumbling Watson, when it came to wrapping the case, comparing two or three equally explanatory, equally comprehensive, and sometimes equally incomplete, explanations for the same set of facts and clues. 

of additional frustration, the punishment phase of every case includes a "moral choice" to absolve or punish the suspect. while there is no "right" answer, the choice is a false one, as which choice you make doesn't affect the ending of the case very much, but affects the epilogue substantially in non-obvious ways. the designers clearly had a "right" ending in mind and In a game all about the freedom to follow the clues and act upon the evidence, the decision to base the final ending upon unrelated choices from unrelated situations seems discordant and atonal. 

In all, it's a highly polished, well built and interesting take on an area of culture that is largely absent from gaming.  At ~12 hours and ~US$30, it's well worth the little bit of frustration for the feeling of being the Great Sherlock Homes.

[h1][b]Einleitung[/b][/h1]
Das Spiel fängt die Atmosphäre des viktorianischen London's ein und ist sehr sehr liebevoll und detailiert gestaltet, angefangen bei der Tapete an der Wand, den Kleidern, Bildern und natürlich der Sprechweise. Als Sherlock Holmes sammelt man Hinweise und nutzt Sherlock Holmes einzigartige Kraft der Schlussfolgerung um aus den verschiedensten Hinweisen ein stimmiges Motiv zu basteln. Oder auch nicht ? Es ist nämlich durchaus möglich zur falschen Lösung zu kommen und einen Unschuldigen anzuklagen. Grafikmaessig ist es einfach top. Man sieht sogar Staubpartikel in der Luft. Vor allem die Gesichter der Charactere und Verdächtigen sehen hyper realistisch aus.

17957075.review:
İnanılmaz bir Sherlock Holmes hayranıyım ve bütün hikayelerini ,romanlarını okudum ve Dedektif oyunları özel ilgi alanımda fakat tabiki Sherlock Holmes olması daha da bir ön plana itiyor bu durumu

Serinin bir önceki oyunu olan The Testament of Sherlock Holmes'i oynamış ve çok beğenmiştim fakat o oyunda eksik olan ve güzel olan şeyler vardı.

The Tastament of Sherlock Holmes'ta Eksik olan Şeyler

-Sherlock'un en önemli özelliği olan karakter tahlilleri yoktu
-Bulduğunuz davaları inanılmaz bir titizlikle not defterine aktarıp sonuca ulaşma sadece ilk görevler için geçerliydi
-Oyunda saçma bir şekilde her şeyi size gösteren bir iç güdü sistemi vardı ve bence oyuna gölge düşüyordu ( bunu kapatmak için en zor moda almanız yeterliydi ama yine de bence bir eksi)
-Oyun ilk davalardan sonra bir dedektiflik oyunundan çıkıyor ve bir düşmana karşı yönelmenizi sağlıyordu yani oyunun başı güzel sonlara doğru hikayesi kötüydü


The Tastament of Sherlock Holmes'ta Güzel olan şey

-Bulmacaları. Evet bu oyunda tek güzel olan şey bulmacaydı ve bu bulmacalar cidden zordu ve oyunu bütün eksilerine rağmen iyi hale getiriyordu

Peki gelelim Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments oyununa.
Bir kere oyunun adı Suç ve Ceza ve Shrlock Holmes oyunda Dostoyevski'nin bu ölümsüz eserinin adının oyuna verilmesi beni bu oyunu alırken ve oynarken cezbetmedi diyemem çünkü ortaokuldan beri Dostoyevski ile büyümüş bir insanım.

Geliştiriciler bu oyuna ne katmışlar peki aslında The Tastament of Sherlock Holmes'ta olmayan çoğu şeyi diyebilirim

Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments'ın güzel yanları

- Dava üzerine temellenen bir oyun olması . Toplamda 6 dava var ve hepsinin içeriği bana kalırsa güzel
- Karakter tahlillerine yer vermesi
- Oyunda sorgulama metodunun olması , bulduğunuz kanıtlara göre soruguladığınız insanların yalanlarını yakalamanız
- Dava defterinin aktif bir şekilde sürekli kullanılması
- Her davanın sonucunda kişiyi yakalama veya serbest bırakma hakkınızın olması yani dava özgürlüğü. ( Burada devlet memuru olmayan Sherlock Holmes ahlaki kararlar verebiliyor ve bu tamamen size bağlı örneğin nefsi müdafa için adam öldürmüş birini tutuklamayabilirsiniz sonuçta polisten önce çözmüş oluyorsunuz olayı )

Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments'ın eksik yanları

- Diğer oyunda iyi olan tek şey bu oyunda geri plana itilmiş. Evet bulmacalar felaket kötü oyunda. Sadece Lock Pick yapıyor gibi hissettim. Bİr kaç deney ve bulmaca haricinde zeka gerektirecek hiçbir şey yapmıyorsunuz. Yapımcılar bu oyunda hikayeyi ön plana çıkarmış ve bulmacaları göz ardı etmişler gözüken o. Ve bu çok acı bir şey çünkü geçen oyunda tek doğru yaptığınız şeyi neden bu oyundan ihmal edersiniz ki ?
- 1 davanın orjinal Sherlock Holmes hikayesinde alınması.  Tahmin edebileceğiniz gibi zaten bildiğiniz bir hikayeyi oynamak o kadar gerçekten sıkıcı. Fakat sherlock holmes kitaplarını okumadıysanız sorun olmayacaktır çünkü o dava da çok zevkli
-Bir yerden bir yere seyahat ederken bir bekleme ekranı yerine bir at arabası yolcuğu koyuyor oyun her seferinde ve burda fps 10-15 e kadar düşebiliyor ve bütün oyun bunu yaşıyorsunuz

Peki genel olarak bu oyun oynanmalı mı ? Evet kesinlikle detektif türüne ilgininiz varsa oynanmalı ama 59 TL bir fiyat gerçekten pahalı inidirme girmesini bekleyin ve 18.75 gibi cazip % 75 indirimli fiyatını bulduğunuzda alın

--Bu arada oyunun resmi yapamasını yapan Techno Game ekibine çok teşekkür ediyorum gerçekten çok güzel ve eksiksiz bir çeviri yapmışlar--

17943713.review: Ein "must have" Spiel für alle Sherlock Holmes Fans!

17932818.review:
Crimes and Punishments ist eine wahrhaft gelungene Fortsetzung der Sherlock Holmes Reihe. Die 6 einzelnen Fälle, die Sherlock Holmes und Dr. Watson lösen, sind sehr atmosphärisch und in sich schlüssig aufgebaut. 
Krimi-Freunde werden alle Hinweise finden können, um zu einer begründeten Lösung des Falls zu kommen, während Gelegenheitsspieler mit der "Schummeltaste" ihre Entscheidung überprüfen und berichtigen können.

PRO:
+ Alle Charaktere, mit denen man interagiert, haben eine eigene und schlüssige Persönlichkeit. Kein Fall und kein Charakter ist lieblos gestaltet oder folgt einem langweiligen Klische.
+ Grafik, Musik und Umgebung formen die passende Atmosphere für jeden Fall
+ Entscheidungsfreiheit! Man kann nicht nur zwischen 2 - 4 möglichen Tätern den richtigen wählen, sondern auch seine Strafe beeinflussen oder entschärfen. Die "Schummeltaste" zeigt lediglich an, ob man den richtigen Täter gewählt hat.
+ kein typisches Point & Click mit willkürlichen Kombinationen abstruser Gegenstände! Alle Handlungen folgen logisch auf die Hinweise und Beweismittel, die man findet.
+ Die Charaktere reagieren auf Erlebnisse im aktuellen Fall, was einige witzige Momente herbeizaubert (z.B. Tai Chi im Wohnzimmer)
+ Alle Rätsel sind ohne Lösungshilfe machbar. Zur Not kann man Rätsel auch überspringen (was bei mir nie nötig war).
+ Das Logbuch hält alle bisherigen Schlussfolgerungen, wichtigen Dialoge, Gegenstände, und aktuelle Aufgaben fest, sodass selbst nach längerer Spielpause keine Ratlosigkeit aufkommt.
+ die Vertonung ist spielfilmreif! Wer seine Englisch-Kenntnisse auffrischen oder verbessern möchte, ist hier genau richtig.
+ Etwa 16 Stunden Spielspaß

CONTRA:
- Wer knifflige Denksportaufgaben sucht, ist hier leider fehl am Platz. Die größten Herausforderungen sind die Kombination aller Indizien, um den wahren Täter zu finden. Die meisten Rätsel beschränken sich auf die richtige Abfolge von Handlungen oder das Manipulieren von Gegenständen, um geometische Formen zu bilden.
- Das "Reisen" zwischen den verschiedenen Handlungsorten des Falls dauert recht lange und ist mitunter sehr häufig nötig.
- Holmes' Macken und Eigenheiten sind meiner Meinung nach zu kurz gekommen. 
- Kein Wiederholungs-Faktor, keine Sidequests. Wer einmal alle Hinweise gefunden hat, hat keinen Anreiz, das Spiel noch einmal zu spielen.

Alles in Allem ein sehr gelungenes Spiel, dass vielleicht nicht süchtig macht, einen aber für viele Stunden in die düstere Welt der Londoner Kriminalität eintauchen lässt. Ich habe den Kauf keine Sekunde lang bereut und kann das Spiel sowohl Gelegenheitsspielern, als auch Knobelfreunden weiterempfehlen.

La serie videoludica di Sherlock Holmes è costellata di punta e clicca, in questo ritroviamo la solita struttura punta e clicca, senza un componente "esplorativa", che sarebbe stata superflua, ma è resa molto più lineare, grazie ai "poteri" di Holmes.

17911249.review:
Gelelim uzun zamandır Türkçe dil desteğini beklediğimiz oynamak içni sabırsızlandığımız oyunun incelenmesine..

Öncelikle Türkçe dil desteği için Technogame ekibine çok teşekkür ederim. Şimdi ise oyunumuzu inceleyelim.

Öncelikli olarak oyun oyuncuya daha fazla özgürlük tanımış bulunmakta, bundan bir önceki oyunda ne yaparsak yapalım aynı sonuca çıkmasından yakınan arkadaşlar için güzel bir uygulama olmuş. Oyunda toplam 6 vaka var ve her vaka için 5-6 farklı sonuç çıkarımı yapabiliyorsunuz. Hatta bu çeşitlilik o kadar fazla ki x davasındaki suçlumuz y olsun. Y ile ilgili 2 farklı seçenek bile çıkarabiliyoruz şöyle yaptı veya bu silahı kullandı gibisinden. Yani doğru suçluyu bilip suçu işleme yöntemi hakkında yanlış çıkarım yapıp yanlış sonuca da ulaşmamız mümkün. Tabi dava sonlarında bulduğumuz suçlu kişinin hemen teslim olmak istememesi ve onunla yaptığımız etkileşimler oyuna güzel bir zevk katmış. Kimi zaman bir suçluyla kavga edeceksiniz kimi zaman silahını doğrultan suçluyu durdurmanız gerekecek. Ayrıca davalarda suçluyu bulmanız durumunda illaki tutuklama işlemi yapacaksınız diye bir kural da bulunmuyor. Seçim bize ait oluyor, suçlunun haklı sebepleri var diyorsak herhangi bir işlem yapmadan suçluyu serbest bırakıp yolumuza devam edebiliyoruz. Dediğim gibi seçim tamamen oyuncuda. Ayrıca her konuştuğunuz tanığı baştan sona incelemek üstünden başından bakışlarından yalan söyleyip söylemediğini anlamak güzel bir tecrübeydi. :)

Onun haricinde Scotland Yard sık sık gittiğimiz bir yer, fakat içeride bulunan kişi sayısı sınırlı ve kendini tekrarlayan türden. Polislerden söz etmiyorum ilk girdiğimizde orada bulunan diğer insanlar bunlar. Her gitmemize özel farklı kişileri görebilseydik daha güzel olurdu diye düşünüyorum. 

Ayrıca oyunda bir yerden diğer yere giderken bekleme ekranında faytonla yolculuk ediyoruz. Şehir içi yolculuk yaparken binaların, şehir dışına giderken kırsal alanların gözükmeside güzel düşünülmüş bir ayrıntıydı. Ve bu yükleme ekranında çıkarım sayfası, davayla ilgili ipuçlarını değerlendirebileceğimiz sayfaları açmak mümkün oluyor. Güzel düşünülmüş bir ayrıntı sanki yolculuk sırasında topladığımız verileri gözden geçirip düşünüyormuşuz havası katıyor. 

Gelelim diğer karakterlerin kontrollerine bundan önceki oyuna göre bu kontroller çok aza indirilmiş. Önceki oyunda Watsonu çok fazla kontrol etmek durumunda kalmıştık, bazı arkadaşların şikayetçi olduğu bir durumdu. Bu oyunda Watson'u son derece az kontrol ediyoruz. Aynı şekilde Toby'ide pek kontrol etmemiz gerekmiyor zorunlu olarak. Fakat Toby konusunda her davada kullanabiliriz gibi gözüküyor çünkü onunla ilgili ayrı bir başarım mevcut, ben pek kullanmadım bizim Toby efendiyi. :)

Bulmacalar ise çok basitleştirilmiş, önceki oyundakiler daha zorlu ve eğlenceliydi. Bunda hemen sonuca ulaşıyorsunuz fakat kapı kilitleri önceki oyuna göre daha zorlaştırılmış bu güzel olmuş. Ama dediğim gibi bulmacalar biraz daha zor olsa daha iyi olabilirdi, zaten çok uğraşmak istemeyen oyuncular için atla seçeneği bulunuyordu. 

Gelelim oyuna uzaktan bakışa, bir önceki oyunda ( sürekli bahsettiğim bir önceki oyun The Testament of Sherlock Holmes'dur bu arada. ) genel bir hikaye söz konusuydu buradaki 6 olay birbirinden tamamen bağımsızdı fakat önceki oyunda birbiriyle bağlantılı olaylar davalar ve daha fazla heyecan vardı. The Testament of Sherlock Holmes'u oynarken sonlara doğru gerçekten oyuncularda büyük bir heyecan oluşmuştu bu oyunda öyle bir durum ne yazık ki yok. Ve önceki oyunda yakındığım Moriarty çok çabuk ve kolay harcandı eleştirim hala geçerli bu oyunda da Moriarty'e dair bir şey göremedik. Umarız 2016'daki oyunda görebiliriz. 

Son olarak oynanış dışı özelliklerden bahsetmek gerekirse oyunu düşük ayarlarda oynamam gerekti bilgisayardan dolayı ve gündüz zamanı dış mekanda geçirdiğimiz sürede çok sıkıntı yaşadım grafik bakımından. Karşılaştığım sorunların resimleri steam hesabımda paylaşılmış durumda. Yerler bembeyaz, havada uçan ağaçlar vs vs gibi olmaması gereken sorunlar vardı. İyi bir sistemde bu sorunlarla karşılaşacağınızı sanmıyorum ama orta-düşük dereceli sistemler için kötü olmuş. 

Özetlemek gerekirse kesinlikle oynamanız gereken bir oyun. Özellikle Türkçe dil desteği gelmişken kaçırmamanız gerekir.

17899677.review:
[h1]A well-executed and immersive deduction game that belongs in your library.[/h1]
[b]MY RATING[/b] | 5 out of 5
[b]WORTH THE FULL PRICE?[/b] | Yes, but I would recommend getting it on a discount to offset the lack of replayability.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments is an absolutely beautiful strategy game where the player's choices ACTUALLY matter. It is simply a must-have for any strategy game junkie.

[b]What It Does Well:[/b]
[list]
[*] Engaging cases to work on
[*] Strikes a balance between casual gameplay and a challenging experience
[*] Mechanics that "just feel right"
[*] BEAUTIFUL graphics that allow for true immersion
[*] Just enough ambiguity on who committed the crime to keep you engaged
[*] Player's choices ACTUALLY matter
[*] Maintains the game's momentum
[/list]

What I loved most about Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments (SHCP) is that [u]it is everything that I want in a deducation game[/u]: interesting work, a bit of a challenge, a beautiful experience, and the feeling that the game isn't trying to force-feed you the right answer. The cases that you work on are distinct and memorable; there are no two cases that share similarities. As you work through the cases, SHCP offers just the right amount of hand-holding to keep the momentum and to really allow the player to feel like Sherlock Holmes. If you were to constantly be getting stuck, it would be easy to fall out of character. Finally, the true hallmark of a great deducation game was the fact that I felt compelled on multiple cases to hold off on accussing someone because I wanted to go revisit the locations, the evidence, and the documents. [u]THAT'S[/u] what I want in a game like this an SHCP delivered.

Something SHCP uniquely provides is the opportunity for the player to make a wrong accusation and the game continues on. There's no "game going back in time" so you can't fix it, or even the game preventing you from making that decision. You are [u]ALLOWED[/u] to make mistakes and it will not penalize you for it. This really allows it to feel as close to reality as possible.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Where It Lacked:[/b]
[*] Replayability
[*] Disjointed "story line" that connected each case
[*] Missed Opportunities
[/list]
Although I'm a huge fan of this game, there were some aspects that could have been better. Replayability for this type of game is unlikely- it's just the genre. However, I figured I would call it out for the buyers who may take this into consideration when buying. In SHCP, there is a very small story line that connects each case. It is so small that I actually forgot about it until the end. It seemed like an after-thought and could have probably been left out. Finally, there was one large missed opportunity to make the game even better. There is a mechanic to call out inconsistencies during conversation which is a real treat. However, if someone says something questionable the game makes it very obvious by slowing down time so Sherlock can speak up. I wish that wasn't the case. The small bits of information you gain from those integral parts should only be award to the people who noticed the lie (just like real life!)

17699446.review:
In Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments spielt man den bekannten Meisterdetektiv Sherlock Holmes. In bester Adventuremanier steuert man Ihn, in Begleitung seines Freundes Watson durch 6 verschiedene Fälle. Anders wie in den Vorgängern, die große Fällle der Romanreihe behandeln (z.b der Hund der Baskervilles) oder eigene Geschichten ( z.b jagt Jack the RIpper oder das Testament des Sherlock Holmes) behandelt das Spiel kleinere Geschichten der Romanreihe (z.b Die Affäre Abbey Grange). Dies ist aber mal etwas erfrischendes im Gegensatz zu den Anderen Teilen der Serie, da man Nachdem man einen Fall abgeschlossen hat, automatisch den nächsten freischaltet. Leider unterschieden sich die Fälle ansich nicht gerade, in fasten Jedem geht es um Mord. Dabei wird auch die BBC Serie ein Wenig in Betracht gezogen, da Holmes so wie auch in der Serie, mithilfe von Texteinblendungen kombiniert. Im Spiel ansich muss mann Objekte untersuchen, sich mit Leuten unterhalten, die Holmes vorher in einem Minispiel genau Unter die Lupe genommen hat, sowie Rätsel lösen. Oft muss Holmes auch in seinem Archiv nachrecherchiren, oder etwas in seinem Chemielabor untersuchen sowie Experimente machen. Dies wirkt gut in Szene gesetzt, es hat deutlich die Beste Grafik aller Spiele, wobei dies auch das neuste ist. Die Details sind auch sehr schön anzusehen. Am Ende jeden Falls muss der Spieler in einem Menü mehrere Aussagen zusammenkombinieren, um den Täter zu finden. Es kommt aber Auf den Spieler an, wenn er als Täter anklagt, das heisst man kann auch einen Falschen Hinter Gitter bringen. Zudem darf man entscheiden, ob man Nett ist und in nicht an die Polizei liefert, oder ihn Gnadenlos an Scotland Yard ausliefert. Auch dies Finde ich echt gelungen. Allerdings gibt es auch ein wenig Kontra. Die Ladezeiten zwischen verschieden Orten ist leider nicht gerade kurz, zudem steht Watson einem Oft im Wege herum, oder hängt irgendwo fest, was bei mir aber auch zu Lachern gesorgt hat ;). 
Ausserdem sollte man ein Wenig Englisch beherrschen, das das Spiel eine Englische Sprachausgabe besitzt, die aber echt gut gemacht ist. Es gibt aber Deutsche Untertitel.
 Ich kann diesen Holmesteil, so wie auch die letzen, sehr empfehlen. 

Fazit:  Sehr gelungenes Adventure, in guter Holmes Manier, dass Spaß macht, und erfrischend anders ist. Zudem ist der Preis gerechtfertig. 

Spielbarkeit: (✔ bedeutet geignet)

Anfänger: ✔
Fortgeschritten/Genrekenner: ✔
Experten: 

SPIELSPAß: 9 von 10
GRAFIK: 8  von 10
STEUERUNG:  8  von 10
SOUNDTRACK: 7  von 10

GESAMT: 32 von 40 Punkten, Sehr zu empfehlen.

17693586.review:
福爾摩斯，我對他其實並不太熟，
過去的接觸點只有過電影、和動畫中提到的片段而已。

初接觸本作是在江小M的遊戲實況中，
當時就認定這真是一款有深度、又有趣的作品。 

當發現英特衛出了中文版，真是超開心啊!!
綁 STEAM帳號、比原價便宜、有中文、又有成就系統，非常超值啊!!


遊戲中，跟隨著大偵探的步調查案，
在頻繁的場景切換中找尋蛛絲馬跡，
需要經過發現、查證、模擬實驗、演繹推理、組合... etc.

不斷的思考和判斷，在緊湊的劇情下，
一投入真讓人想接著看下去XD! 
案子平均耗費3小時腦力，就像真的在看福爾摩斯電影一樣，感覺非常充實啊 !!


和大家分享幾個有趣的點：
1. 跟緊緊的夥伴
　　很多時候，場景搭上詭譎的音樂，其氛圍非常令人發毛。
　　如果這種時候，有人「突然出現」是非常過份的，
　　我常常一個轉頭就被華生嚇個半死... 

2. 不同的角色扮演
　　視場景或劇情需要，有機會扮演其他角色。比方：偵探犬的視角。


優點的部分：
1. 豐富的人物感情：人物焦慮的汗水、各種情感的肢體語言都很真實。
2. 多重結局：根據判斷和道德的抉擇，讓故事有著許多變化。
3. 結案前上一動：若想看其他結論，可在抉擇後回頭重新做演繹推斷，就不用再重頭跑一遍了!!  
4. 精美又有深度的畫面：許多運鏡、和造景都很迷人!! 


個人遊戲耗時紀錄：(用Steam累積時數計算) 
第一關 3  小時 、第二關 3小時、第三關 3.1小時 
第四關 1.8小時、第五關 2小時、第六關 2.5小時
最後為了成就狂個性，額外 7小時左右，重頭到尾快速衝刺 XD


在本作中認識的大偵探福爾摩斯，真覺得他超帥的啊XD 
如果這時重新去認識他的電影，應當會有不一樣的發現!

17584187.review:
Die Kunst der Deduktion, Verbrechen aufklären indem man von der Spurenlage, über Rückschlüsse daraus, zum Tatablauf und dadurch zum Täter und seinem Motiv findet. Sherlock Holmes bzw. seinem Schöpfer Sir Arthur Conan Doyle verdanken wir (und die moderne Kriminalistik) das Vergnügen, Verbrechen durch Spurenlage und reine Logik aufzuklären. CSI lässt grüßen.

Ich bin ein Fan von Sherlock, und so lag nichts näher, als alle Spiele die es zum Thema gibt zu spielen, und keines hat mich bisher wirklich enttäuscht. Auch "Crimes and Punishment" nicht, obwohl ich mir noch ein bischen mehr Handlungsfreiheit gewünscht hätte. Aber das kann ja beim nächsten Spiel noch kommen. Conan Doyle hat ja mehr als genug passenden Stoff für unzählige weitere Spiele hinterlassen, den man bis heute nicht angefasst hat. Eigentlich schade.

Kaufempfehlung? Wer auf Kopfarbeit steht, und ausnahmsweise mal auf Geballer verzichten kann - absolut.
Alle anderen sollten es vielleicht doch noch versuchen. Kann sein, das sie eine neue Leidenschaft entdecken ... eben die Kunst der Deduktion.

17553453.review:
Dieses Spiel hat seine sehr Gute Atmosphäre, man mag es sehen, wie man will, dass ein paar Fälle auf direkte Romanvorlagen von Arthur Conan Doyle zurück gehen, aber eben auch diese Fälle sind sehr gut umgesetzt.  Schön gemacht sind auch die Figuren (einen recht Charmant aussehenden Holmes :D, einen glaubhaft aussehenden Dr. Watson, Lestrade, Mrs. Hudson, Wiggins etc)

Gut gemacht, ist auch die Art der Deduction (bei der es so wirkt, als könne man Sherlock Holmes tatsächlich in den Kopf sehen, wenn er seine Schlüsse zieht.) ebenso, wie die Charakter Analysen. Was auch positiv zu sehen ist, ist die Tatsache, dass das Spiel einem die "Freiheit" lässt, seine eigenen Schlüsse zu ziehen, so dass man auch gefahr läuft "aus Versehen" ;) den / die falschen Person/en zu überführen :D 

Ausserdem ist es immmer wieder schön zu sehen, dass "alte" bekannte Personen als Zuckerl auftauchen, die schon seit langen in den früheren Frogware Spielen durch London /Whitchapel spaziert sind (mit denen man auch in diesen Spielen gesprochen hat,)

Aber da gibt es doch kleine Kritikpunkte
* Watson versperrt teilweise nur den Weg :D
* Es ist schade, dass sehr oft fast alle Kleider im Schrank und fast alle Perrücken und Brillen gesperrt sind (ausser  wenn man diese im Fall braucht)
* Es wäre echt schön gewesen, wenn man wie in manchen älteren Spielen (Lupin, Jack the Ripper etc) auch ein bisschen durch die Baker Street gehen könnte bzw duch London bzw Whitechapel.

17510151.review:
An all-around great adventure game!
Variation in the mysteries keeps the game from becoming to repetative, but rather fresh and interesting. The new engine runs beautifully and the textures allow for a very immersive game-experience, though I at times wish some of the 'maps', such as the train stations, were a bit bigger...
The mini-game puzzles for the most also differ alot, which, again, keeps the game from becoming teedious and boring.
The indidual cases are well thought-out and just as you think you have the right answer everything gets flipped on you...

However, perhaps one of my personal favourite features about this game, is the ability to not only choose what fate shall befall the criminal, but also - perhaps especially - the ability to get the wrong answer. In some games, the game is programed in such a way that you will not be able to preceed before you've got the right solution; something that, at least to some degree, ruins the ability to fully immerse yourself in the story. In Crimes and Punishment, however, the game just rolls with the flow - even if you royally cock up.

All in all a very enjoyable game. Def recommend it!

My apologies for my lack of comprehension of the English language.

Un buon adventure game di tipo investigativo da valutare positivamente :)

Pregi:

- Il gioco presenta 6 casi indipendenti, ognuno con finali differenti
- Buona longevità (circa 18 ore, mediamente 3 ore per caso)
- Impersonare Sherlock Holmes

Consiglio vivamente l'acquisto di questo gioco ad un prezzo pari o inferiore ai 10 euro

Voto: 7,5

A hidden gem in detective adventures. The controls are slightly annoying, and the game sorts of handholds you too much at certain points, but how your clues and investigations affect your choices, and its consequence, are pulled off fantastically.

17451555.review:
I've played many, many point-and-click mystery games, and many games based on Sherlock Holmes. This is, by far, one of the best I've ever encountered. It's seamlessly designed, beautifully crafted, amusing, intriguing, and unique. So, full and absolute recommendation.

The true moment where this game shines above all other Sherlock-ian homages is in the final moments of each case. Once you've collected all the evidence and pieced together the puzzle, you're presented with multiple "conclusions," that is, multiple theories of the crime that can fit the facts and evidence. While collecting all the evidence isn't too difficult, figuring out which theory is correct relies entirely on the player interpreting the facts, leaving you, and you alone, to make that final decision.

What's more, even once you've made your decision, you're given yet another choice: how will you close the case? And here, there's no correct, or incorrect, answer, leaving the ending of each story entirely up to the player, dependent on what you believe is the appropriate moral choice.

The combination of strict deductive methods and a very true-to-the-source portrayal of Holmes with this moral ambiguity actually got me to care about what I was doing in the game, to pay attention to the dialogue and plots moreso than just to solve the case. That, to me, is the best win a mystery series could accomplish.

However - PARTIAL SPOILER ALERT BELOW - 

- NO REALLY THIS MAY RUIN A REVEAL FOR YOU - 

- LAST CHANCE - 

I have one caveat, concerning one, single scene, which happens to be the penultimate scene of the game and not actually associated with any of the individual cases.

There's ... some attempt at an overarching plot thread that lurks in the background of the cases and cumulates in a final confrontation after the last case is solved. You end up sitting through a cutscene that involves a militant revolutionary group explaining their motivations, which is very anti-aristocracy. If you lean left, you might call it a group of Victorian-era "99%" protesters. If you lean right, you might call them communist terrorists.

Either way it comes across as more than a little preachy, especially since, no matter what option you pick, you can't actually arrest them. (I could be wrong, because I haven't replayed the game with every alternate moral choice path to see if being a hard case could change that last scene, but I highly doubt it would. If you can arrest them, it's still weird, though, see below.) It's not because the game forces you to sympathize with them: it's stated, if you decide against the group, that Holmes lets them go because he's irritated at the person who needs to deal with them. Still, the fact that you sit through the leader's heated defense of his cause and then can't have them all arrested, and the wording choice in the final scene, indicates a very strong political preference on the part of the game designers.

Normally I would shrug and move on. It's their game; if I had fun playing it, and was engaged by the story, then a political or philosophical message is just an interesting element of the experience. The problem here is that the rest of the game is SO very wonderful by comparison, and so very well crafted to give the player that control over moral choice. Being given this ultimate choice that doesn't really represent a moral choice undermined the entire system.

Morover, Holmes is a very anti-political character. Anyone who's read the original stories will tell you that Holmes is the kind of man who has memorized the law and lives by it, and doesn't give a damn about politics. Much as modern interpretations might give him depth of feelings or awarenesses, the classic Holmes, which this game was trying very much to emulate, would never allow a group of people who admitted to planning and organizing a large-scale violent act to flee in order to potentially commit more violent crimes.

FINAL VERDICT - 

Fantastic game that I loved deeply and could not stop playing, though I really wish the last two scenes just didn't exist because they kind of ruin it.

The moral decisions are a great twist on the genre and I purposely replayed the endings to see what difference my conclusions made.

If you're a Sherlock fan or just want a great  and enjoyable romp, then I can't recommend this highly enough!

17442418.review:
[i]"Be quiet Watson, I'm trying to concentrate."[/i]

As puzzle games go, Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments is fairly tame. As tedious as the achievement for reaching all conclusions is (if that matters), the game is worth the experience - well thought-out characters, realistic motivations and a chance to play at being the world's greatest detective.

There are six individual cases, or chapters if you will, each with a unique crime for you to solve. Gameplay involves first gathering the evidence in the form of point-and-click / exploration. Suspects and other people are interviewed. During the course of doing this, sometimes additional information about clues you find can only be discovered by researching Holmes' archive, or by conducting an experiment, or even by chemical analysis. All of these actions combine to give you deductions, which take the form of facts floating around inside Holmes' brain, visualised by neurons firing between each other.

The next part is what I find to be the most fun though. Just having these facts floating around inside your head isn't enough. You have to put them together. For example: a person needs a certain [b]Strength Requirement[/b] to wield a harpoon properly, also you know the victim was [b]Pinned to the Wall[/b]. Put them together, and you conclude the murderer must be physically strong. Put enough of the facts together and you'll be able to conclude who the guilty party is.

It comes as no surprise that there are various conclusions for each chapter. Each of them makes its own kind of logical sense, and is fun to experiment with. There is even a 'correct' answer to each of the cases - and the opportunity to check whether you have the right one or not is entirely optional, meaning nothing is given away without your wanting it. The only problem I find with replaying for different endings is the necessity of starting the case over again from scratch - there is no option to simply replay your deductions from near the end of the case. This unfortunately makes for a bit of a grind as some cases have numerous location changes - many of which are for as little as a single item - meaning you will grow bored of seeing the interior of Holmes's carriage very quickly. One case has as many as six different endings.

More on the gameplay. I've already mentioned finding objects, interrogation, drawing deductions. In addition, there is lockpicking (an interesting take on a concept rife in so many games today), imagination (a little-used idea that works well to break up other gameplay elements), and there are also conversation events whereby Sherlock catches people out in lies. Leaving people gaping like fish and floundering for words is very enjoyable.

The cast for voice-acting is excellent, although I think it is soured by Robinson's aussie accent. There are two aussies in this game - while Lady Brackenstall sounds more genuine, Robinson sounds exaggerated, a bit too much like Steve Irwin for my liking. Perhaps for the time-period (1890s) this is accurate, and perhaps it adds to his character, but I just found it too over-the-top.

The visuals are mildly impressive. While nothing stands out as particularly fantastic, the landscapes and rooms depicted are done well enough that you feel transported to late 19th Century England. Typewriters and the general hubbub of Scotland Yard offices is one of the better sounds.

In closing, I should point out that the game is inspired by Arthur Conan Doyle's stories, and that [i]Crime and Punishment[/i] is a reference to Fyodor Dostoyevsky's novel of the same title - giving the gamer the opportunity to find the right culprit, and to make the moral choice of condemning or absolving their actions.

17236170.review:
Я на Steam недавно, всего пару месяцев с небольшим, и эта игра стала одной из первых в моей коллекции. Раньше не слышал о серии игр о Шерлоке Холмсе от этой студии, когда где-то наткнулся, то заинтересовался, решил попробовать крайнюю игру серии - эту - как более удачную в плане графики. И не разочарован выбором! С удовольствием провел в игре 20+ часов, единственное капитальное разочарование - это то, что игра, наконец, кончилась)))

Плюсы:
- Не идеальная, но вполне качественная графика. Местами можно сделать интересные скриншоты. Для игр такого жанра - хорошо, по сравнению с предыдущей игрой серии - значительный прорыв
- 6 различных новелл, посвященных разным, не связанным делам, в каждой последующей есть своя изюминка и что-то новое по сравнению с предыдущими. 2 новеллы взяты из Дойля, 4 - придуманы для игры. Баланс получился неплохой, учитывая то, что вновь придуманное - вполне качественно, как мне показалось, с литературной точки зрения
- игра не линейна, в том плане, что все находки и открытия в ходе очередного расследования не приводят к единственному возможному выводу (иначе, я думаю, было бы менее интересно). Можно построить несколько различных дедуктивных выводов и обвинить разных подозреваемых, Правильное решение принимает уже сам игрок. Кто-то писал, что ему всё равно, кого повесят, я же в половине дел провёл много времени в конце, додумывая - кто же убийца, и получал облегчение, когда моё решение оказывалось верным (верность вывода в итогах расследования выводится как спойлер )))
- установив/выбрав преступника, можно сделать и другой выбор - моральный: либо предать виновника суду, либо дать ему билет в новую жизнь. Мы помним, что Холмс Конана Дойля иногда поступал вторым способом.
- Холмс часто проводит следственные эксперименты, выражающиеся в паззлах/мини-играх. Некоторые из них оказываются довольно интересными
- Русской озвучки нет, но английская - не подкачала, также как и сами тексты диалогов. Мне показалось, что очень хороший, интересный язык. Иногда встречается здоровая доля юмора.

Минусы:
- К концу игры мне жутко поднадоели мини-игры на открытие замков. Лишь пару раз (сейфы) это было что-то особенное, во всех остальных случаях это одно и то же, не взирая на тип замка (врезной, навесной, замок шкатулки).
- Холмс очень много шарит по чужим вещам без ведома хозяев, без стыда и совести. В книгах настолько - не было.
- Показалась мрачноватой и даже немного жуткой концовка. Вовлекли политику (но аллюзий на современное не нашел, слава богу), оказалась небольшой ложкой дёгтя...

Что имеем в итоге? Я получил интересное приключение, местами чувствовал себя настоящим детективом, эффект погружения - отличный. Появился интерес к играм данного жанра. Однозначно рекомендую эту игру.

С учётом небольшого числа минусов, ставлю 90 пуль в вензеле Victoria Regina на стене гостиной из 100 )))

17210275.review:
Прошёл игру с огромным удовольствием.
Когда-то давно я пробовал играть в другие квесты этой студии, но отступил перед безумной сложностью головоломок. Теперь эта проблема наконец-то исправлена. Игра относится к игроку по-человечески и разрешает менять выбор. Выбрал неверный вариант диалога? Перевыбери. Обвинил не того человека? Передумай. Тяжело проходить головоломку? Пропусти. Это невероятно радует, потому что ты действительно играешь, а не мучаешься. Например, в одном из дел я не смог пройти по верёвочному мосту самостоятельно. Что сделала бы типичная игра в этом случае? Ничего, "не можешь пройти - не пройдёшь". А здесь я пропустил этот сложный момент и пошёл дальше по сюжету. Вот так и надо делать квесты, и тогда каждый обеспечит себе ровно ту сложность головоломок, которая его устраивает, а более сложные "решит" автоматически.
Также понравился способ дедуктивных размышлений через объединение улик в различные выводы, поиск этих улик и вообще вся механика игры. Действительно чувствуешь, что раскрываешь преступления, комбинируя факты и превращая их в выводы. Хотя, возможно, я просто вспоминал прочитанное ранее - тут нужно отметить, что дела основаны на реальных рассказах.
Графика довольно хороша, не считая мелких неприятностей, вроде загораживающего дверь или застревающего в текстурах Ватсона. Конечно, герои нарисованы в традиционном стиле, что позволяет смотреть ролики как хорошее кино-детектив. Музыка тоже на высоте, приятно подобраны голоса в озвучке. Помимо отдельных сюжетов для каждого преступления есть и общий сквозной сюжет, который делает игру единым целым. В общем и целом это отличный квест, чтобы скоротать пару-тройку вечеров. Ставлю 9 из 10.


--

17106329.review:
Игра с самого первого шага вступает одной левой ногой в дерьмо. "Памяти сотни", вплетать политику в игру – это самый идиотский шаг. Я мог бы сейчас начать расписывать этот момент, но хрен с ним – пусть останется на совести самой больной части коллектива разработчиков.  
Дальше игра начинает ходить по дерьму, как по ковролину. Ватсон здесь – вечно мешающийся под ногами кусок мяса или стенд для экспериментов Шерлока.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=483673460
Сам Шерлок стал редким идиотом – из гения сверхъестественной дедукции его сделали банальным собирателем улик, который может трактовать их, как ему угодно, и это даже поощряется разработчиками! Обвини всех встреченных людей, подгони все дедуктивные выводы под своё обвинение. Шерлок этой игры действует в лучших традициях нелюбимой им самим полиции. Этот шаг в дерьмо уже вгоняет ногу по колено. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=483673086
Разорванное на шесть лоскутов повествование – это не самая большая проблема, но вот второстепенная линия про Весёлых Молодцов вгоняет в уныние, ведь последнее решение должно быть не просто взвешенным, мы должны подходить к нему всю игру, но этого нет. Мы просто выбираем: стать соучастником террористов или остаться нормальным Шерлоком Холмсом. Ещё одна, видимо, отсылка к событиям на Украине, потому что главный террорист очень подходящую речь говорит, а если её состыковать с прологом игры, так вопросов не остаётся.
Так и получается, что игра – глубоко политизированное произведение, которое пытается подменить понятия справедливости, закона. Здесь почти невозможно сделать Шерлока не "коррумпированным", потому что выборы, которые нам дают, бывают из разряда "двух зол", но в более худшем смысле, чем это было, например, в Ведьмаке, где Геральт пытался поступать правильно, а получал сомнительный результат. Здесь же нам сразу дают выбрать сомнительный результат, что делает Шерлока то ли большим идиотом, то ли ещё каким-то монстром. 
Любые ошибки и неверные решения просто откатывают нас на шаг назад – никаких штрафов или последствий, зачем вообще тогда эта игра?
К озвучке и графону претензий не имею. 
Игра не понравилась, но я достаточно предвзят: я очень сильно уважаю Шерлока Холмса и очень не уважаю современную Украину. 
Следующую игру от этих же разработчиков я буду препарировать достаточно долго, прежде чем, возможно, решусь купить. А если там что-нибудь опять будет про "память" или подобное, то точно покупать не стану. Зашквар есть зашквар.

17088169.review:
9/10

genre : point and click adventure game in 3rd person

 Another Sherlock Holmes adventure game, where as the famous detective , you have to solve 6 varied cases such as thefts, murders and missing persons.

+ Awesome presentation, best looking adventure game i have ever played, especially the character models are some of the best i have seen in gaming.
+ The cases you have to solve are varied and the atmosphere is dark, grim at times, the writing and dialogues are excellent.
+ Great soundtrack and voice acting.
+ Gameplay wise you use the famous skills of Sherlock : collect clues, examine them, use your tools at Baker's street, interrogate suspects at crime scenes or at the Scotland Yard, reconstruct crime scenes and use intuition skills to discover hidden clues, use your loyal dog , use disguises and much more to collect all the evidence and from your deductions name the guilty parties. Apart from discovering who is guilty you have to make moral decisions as to what their fate will be and at the end of each case you get to see the percentage of other people's choices. There is great freedom of choice, since after gathering some evidence you can choose who is guilty or continue playing , since most of the times you have to go beyond the obvious and collect more clues to find the truth.
+ Unless you do everything right in each case from the first time , there is some replayability, i had to replay 2 of the cases since i was biased the first time playing them .
+ Good duration, over 15 hours to complete all cases.

- Long loading times.
- Some stiff animations.
- I didn't like the lockpicking puzzle as mini-game, often skipped it.

 This is one of the most polished adventure games i have ever played, definitely the best adventure game of the year (although my heart still prefers the dreamfall chapters) and one of the best of the last years. I didn't want it to end but again i had to replay some cases since i missed some clues. It's on the easy side but it can get really hard at times to discover everything and come to the right conclusion. Highly recommended whether on sale or not.

17071066.review:
Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments Review

Yes Watson, it is elementary.... we have a very solid 3rd person Detective game here.

It is certainly an improvement on the previous instalment of the series with better gameplay, better graphics, better deduction system, but still some room for improvement.

I won't be doing a detailed review on this one as it will inevitably create spoilers. I will however note that each case has several possible conclusion (wrong and correct ones) and it is possible to get carried away by a wrong version or uncertainty. If however you are paying attention to all clues (which are not that hard to find) and apply common logic you would not have issues with this game, you will enjoy it.

Time wise, if you go slow and read through all the in-game materials you are looking at 15-17 hours of gameplay.

On the negative side I can say that once you get hold of it the game becomes easy, controls are a bit glitchy, and there is a lack of British humour (there is some, but could have been more).

All in all this is a solid detective game that flows in an interactive story of each individual case you work on. 7/10

For more reviews join my group - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ogrreview/

17068847.review:
A very pleasant surprise. This game surprised me by having a pretty sophisticated way that events can chain and collide to produce many different results. For fans of the stories, it's a great reimagining. I can't say for sure if it will impress those who aren't familiar with Doyle's books but simply like adventure games, but I think it ought to work for both kinds of players.

As with any adventure game, there are occasional snags where you think the elements are uncovered but the game requires one more tiny nudge to prove that you've understood. Those rare occasions can be a little frustrating, but aside from that it's a very polished indie game with a lot to recommend it. Some people have complained that they weren't entirely sure if they'd got the right man/woman at the end of each case - if that happens to you, you probably haven't solved the crime correctly. I think it's good that the game allows you to get it wrong without telling you plainly, and only shows you that you were right if you were right, but not everyone will see that as a strength.

17052508.review: Any Sherlock fans must buy this game immediately.  I wish I didn't even buy it during the sale to encourage the publishers to continue their brilliant work.  It allows you to step into the mind of the great detective and solve the cases yourself.  My only complaint was that some of the case conclusions were a bit too easy, but otherwise the difficulty was perfect in that it wasn't too mind numbing but not a breeze either.  Thank you for taking the time to portray Sherlock and Watson faithfully to Arthur Conan Doyle's creation.

17037709.review:
In my opinion, this Sherlock Holmes game is the best Frogwares has created to date. I found myself fully engaged and as a Sherlock Holmes' fan, utterly delighted.

Pros: -Shorter cases. I enjoyed the longer cases in previous games, but felt the shorter cases were easier to wrap my mind around and get a complete sense of the whole mystery. It was also easier then to sift through evidence and come to a sound conclusion.
-Getting to come to your own conclusion. In the previous games, Holmes guided you through. In these games, you ARE the detective. And you can get it wrong. It makes the game all that more intense since I know I can lose.
-The ease of assessing information. The file system makes it easy to look over all the information you have gathered. The deduction board was is an ingenious way to put the clues together. You make links between different information and evidence to form conclusions and there can be multiple conclusions.
-The mysteries are solvable. I do not like it when a mystery game's answer comes out of nowhere and you feel that you never had a chance to solve it. The mysteries in this game are all solvable. If you go over the clues, review evidence, reread dialogue and think about it, you can get the right answer. I got all but one of them correct. I had determined to go over all the evidence thoroughly before deciding on a final answer and that helped. But still, pressing the button to launch my conclusion always had me nervous! I looked back over all the evidence of the one mystery I solved incorrectly and realized what erroneous conclusions I had drawn.
-In my opinion, the best addition is the morality choices. In Conan Doyle's stories, Holmes often makes moral decisions concerning the fate of the culprits. He does not consider himself necessarily bound by conventional law. The morality choices were an added layer that made the game all the more real and like the Holmes stories.
-Two of the stories are Conan Doyle stories. They were modified a little, but not enough to take away Conan Doyle's original plots. I am a Conan Doyle fan and so enjoyed getting to play his own stories. One was an obscure enough story that I recognized it, but didn't remember much about it and so had to figure it out along with all the other mysteries. The other I knew very well and flew through the case, but it was still fun to be in the story.
-The variety of the cases. Nothing was redundant. Each case was unique and completely held my interest.
-Telescope easter egg. So funny.

Cons: -As someone who adores the Conan Doyle stories, I didn't like the characterization of Mycroft. It seems the thing these days in recreated Holmes stories and shows to make Sherlock and his brother antagonists. They just are not like this in Conan Doyle's stories. At one point, Sherlock tells Watson in one of the Conan Doyle stories that he has gone to Mycroft at times for help. And if Mycroft were to show up asking Sherlock for help, he would not be indifferent.
-The characterizations of Watson and Holmes also suffer a little. Watson is turned more towards the bumbling idiot Watson. Sherlock is made more aloof and cold than in previous games.
-In one of the mysteries, a clue is worded in such a way that it can lead the player to an incorrect conclusion. I decided to ignore the wording in light of other evidence and that led me to the right answer, but I was worried it would be incorrect because of the clue wording.
-There is less freedom to explore your environment than in previous games.  The game boxes you into an area and if you wander to the edge throws the map in your face. That was a little off putting and reminded me I was playing a game. I would have rather Holmes had said something like, "There is nothing interesting over there."
-Final screen. Once you've finished the whole game it seems like there is going to be a cut scene, but nothing happens.

17013341.review:
Le meilleur des Sherlock Holmes à mes yeux !
Contrairement aux autres, il laisse la possibilité au joueur d'effectuer ses propres hypothèses et déductions afin d'accuser un suspect... quitte à se tromper ! Le fait d'avoir plusieurs petites affaires plutôt qu'une grande est également rafraichissant et offre de la diversité, aussi bien dans les intrigues que dans les personnages rencontrés ou les lieux visités.

Dommage toutefois que le jeu soit trop facile. Les déductions sont assez simples, ainsi que les mini jeux.
L'outil "imagination" ne sert quasiment à rien : il aurait du être plus développé afin d'élaborer, au sein de cette "imagination", plusieurs théories.

17011518.review:
Если кратко, то игра на 6.5/10. Полное мнение ниже: 
Новый Шерлок Холмс, старательно ворует фишки из L.A. Noire и Murdered: Soul Suspect. В целом у него это получается весьма удачно. Всего в игре представлено 6 никак между собой несвязанных дел, часть из них основана на рассказах Артура Конана Дойла, часть придумали разработчики. Несмотря на все написанное ниже, поиграть в игру стоит. Лично мне понравились всего два дела, второе и последнее. В последнем деле  правда, я чуть в голос не заржал когда нам пришлось повторять подвиги ГГ из фильма "Один дома". Рассыпать бусы на вверху лестницы, что бы преступник упал и потерял сознание? Вы, не шутите? Ковер над люком в подвал? Смешно. Так же хочется отметить третье дело, оно просто отвратительно скучно. Даже не скучно, а надоедает. Это единственное дело где  я обвинил невиновного человека, да и то только по тому, что хотел побыстрее закончить его.  Эбби-Грейндж и Кью-Гарденс просто не вызвали у меня никаких эмоций. Игру пилили на движке Unreal Engine 3, и в целом добились приемлемой графики. Особенно удалась лицевая анимация. Но деревья и прочая растительность, заставляет вспомнить 2007 год. Так же, благодаря свежести движка, каждый диалог это загрузка. Захотел поговорить с человеком? Жди секунд 10. Немного, но надоедает. В каждом деле вам нужно будет перемещаться между 3-4 локациями, и каждый раз вы будете сидеть в кэбе и смотреть на то как Шерлок листает книжку по минуте, как минимум. Опять же, вроде немного, но когда вам надо сначала приехать на место преступления(1 загрузка), потом обратно в квартиру для анализа улики(еще одна загрузка), потом обратно, что бы с новой уликой опросить свидетеля.(загрузка) Потом тебе открывается новая локация и ты должен ехать туда. Надоедает. Еще хочется отметить слитый характер Ватсона, он просто никакой. Над характером Тоби(собака) поработали больше. Разрабам надо было брать пример с L.A. Noire, где с напарниками все гораздо лучше.   Теперь непосредственно о геймплее. Мы должны обшаривать место преступления и опрашивать свидетелей. Здесь с этим все нормально. Но делать это проще чем в Нуаре. Вообще игра менее хардкорна чем Нуар. Так же иногда надо юзать СУПЕРСПОСОБНОСТИ Холмса, это воображение и СПЕЦИАЛЬНЫЙ ДЕДУКТИВНЫЙ ВЗГЛЯД,  если первая в некоторых случаях помогает нам восстановить ход событий, то вторая, строго в определённых местах, помогает нам увидеть новые улики. О необходимости юзать способности нас уведомит иконка на экране. Так же мы можем создавать портрет персонажа. Благодаря нашей наблюдательности и тому, что когда ты наводишь курсор на нужное место он подсвечивается, мы можем узнать больше о персонажах и это помогает нам в разговорах. Так же, в игре есть миниигры, вроде взлома замков, проведение опытов на лабораторном столе и тд. Но все они наскучивают после 5 раза. Благо их можно пропустить. На прохождение одного дела у вас уйдет от одного до двух часов. И стоит отметить, что в игру лучше играть с геймпада.

17000909.review:
I really enjoyed this game. The graphics are beautiful and the Victorian settings look and feel realistic without any noticeable anachronisms. Each episode has its own look and feel with a different theme: Roman baths, elaborate gardens, wealthy estates, etc. The dialogue and voice acting are excellent.

The puzzles aren't hard, so the game moves along at a pleasingly quick pace. I only had to consult a walkthrough once. This would be a really nice game to try out as a first foray into the adventure genre.

It's very fun to try and put the clues together at the end of the case to make the right decision. I actually decided incorrectly on one of the cases, so it's not always a completely obvious foregone conclusion. You do have to think.

16989839.review: Gutes Spiel, schöne Grafik aber auch zu lange Ladezeiten und zu wenige Charaktere auf den Schauplätzen. 6 spannende Fälle, die nicht miteinander zusammenhängen

16974654.review:
[code]В последнее время к рассказам Артура Конан Дойля о приключениях Шерлока Холмса возвращаются всё чаще и чаще. Сериал Sherlock от канала BBC, серия фильмов Гая Ричи с Робертом Дауни младшим, пародия на хороший сериал - "Элементарно", ну и не хочется забывать уже довольно старый, но до сих пор актуальный советский сериал с Василием Ливановым в главной роли - и это только самые известные экранизации. Игр же о приключениях самого великого детективов в мире тоже не мало, но все они были слишком утомительны, исключением не была и The Testament of Sherlock Holmes, разработчики которой обещали захватывающий сюжет. Да, игроки получили в итоге действительно неплохой сюжет, но захватывающий? Не. И вот, спустя год, та же украинская студия Frogwares, что занималась разработкой этой игры, анонсировала приквел событиям Testament под названием Crimes & Punishments. С уверенностью могу сказать, что это пока что лучшая игра о Шерлоке.

[code][h1]СЮЖЕТ[/h1][/code]
Перед нами шесть абсолютно разных дел. Некоторые из них, кстати, основаны на оригинальных рассказах Конан Дойля. Чтобы правильно раскрыть дело, придется добиваться истины очень долго и кропотливо. Виновных в каждом деле как минимум трое, и у каждого из них есть свой мотив, чтобы поквитаться с жертвой. И распутывать дело из-за этого становится еще интереснее. Прохождение одного дела может занять от получаса до двух-трёх часов. Пару слов о Шерлоке. По сравнению с Testament, Шерлок здесь стал более импульсивным и нелинейным персонажем, при этом сохранил каноничность образа. Особенно из-за того, что его диалоги были прописаны сценаристами так же банально и нудно, как и в прошлой игре и имеют неприятный выделяющийся британский привкус.
[h1]Оценка: 8/10[/h1]

[code][h1]ГРАФИКА[/h1][/code]
Если игра вас не впечатлит диалогами и сюжетом, то поверьте, глазам, по крайней мере, будет приятно из-за большого количества использованных в игре эффектов и фильтров. Разработчики потрудились и над оптимизацией, эта игра работает у меня намного плавнее, чем предшественник. Без минусов все равно тут не обошлось. Как и многие разработчики в наше время, Frogwares не стала трудиться над заполнением игры новыми моделями и просто набила игру шаблонами из Testament, ну а почему бы и нет? Лицевая анимация ужасна, даже при том, что сами лица выглядят довольно неплохо, эмоций на них за всю игру вы не увидите.
[h1]Оценка: 6/10[/h1]

[code][h1]МЕХАНИКА[/h1][/code]
В геймплее очень мало новшеств, но о тех, что появились, расскажу. Как понял, из-за впечатления разработчиков от сериала BBC с Камбербэтчем, в котором Шерлок то и дело, что читал людей по их внешнему виду, в игре появилась возможность создать портрет персонажа таким образом, чтобы по атрибутам и особенностям одежды Шерлок, зачастую не понятно как, смог узнать историю этого самого человека. И часто это ну вообще никаким образом не помогает при расследовании. Во время допросов, если допрашиваемый вами человек врёт, игра вам как бы намекнет квик-тайм-ивентом, успев провести который, можно уличить его в лжи, подобно L.A. Noire, но казуальнее в отличии от последнего. В игре достаточно головоломок, некоторые из которых требуют действительно хорошо развитого мышления. Шерлока наделили также и специальными способностями, вроде воображения и улучшенного зрения, при использовании которого можно увидеть незаметные глазу улики, но когда управляя Шерлоком, вы проходите рядом с этой уликой, игра вам, опять же, намекнет, что стоило бы включить это зрение. Из-за этого вся сложность поиска улик сразу исчезает. Необходимо всего навсего обойти локацию пару раз и все нужные улики и сведения будут уже найдены.
[h1]Оценка: 8/10[/h1]

Любители квестов и в принципе книг Конан Дойля не проходите мимо. Если себя считаете ни тем и ни другим, скорее всего дропните игру через час-два.
[h1]Итого: 7,3/10[/h1]

16974514.review:
Best detective game I've ever played !

16964165.review:
Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments fesselt von der ersten bis zur letzten Sekunde. Die sechs Fälle, die es zu lösen gilt, empfand ich als durchweg spannend, logisch und überzeugend. Das System der Deduktion ist prima umgesetzt und am Ende muss man in den meisten Fällen gehörig nachdenken, um die richtige Entscheidung zu treffen. Das macht den Reiz des Spiels aus. Es ist nicht immer so eindeutig und auch wenn die Abfolge der Untersuchung linear erscheint, liegt es doch an der eigenen Beurteilung, welchen Ausgang jeder einzelne Fall nimmt.

Nach erfolgreicher Aufklärung des letzten Falles, wollte ich noch mehr. Das sagt einiges aus. Und da ist es um sich bedauerlicher, dass es wohl keine weiteren Fälle als DLC geben wird. Das, obwohl der Aufbau in einzelne kleinere Fälle gerade danach schreit.
Ich hoffe jedenfalls, dass die Fortsetzung der Reihe an das Spielprinzip von Crimes und Punishment anknüpfen wird und das überzeugende Spielprinzip in Zukunft durch DLCs neue Fälle erhalten kann. Ich würde Sie mir kaufen.

Kleinere Abstriche muss man beim Schwierigkeitsgrad machen. Hier ist das System vielleicht etwas zu zuvorkommend, indem es einen an wichtigen Stellen direkt anzeigt, was man tun sollte. Es wäre schön gewesen, wenn man hier selbst drauf kommen müsste.

Fazit: Kein Fehlkauf. Ganz und gar nicht. Hat sehr viel Spaß gemacht. Wäre schön gewesen, wenn es in der Folge weitere Fälle zum download gegeben hätte. Insgesamt, ein überzeugendes Spielsystem mit Potential für die Fortsetzung.

16958147.review:
Игра довольно интересная.
В ней нету единого сюжета, а есть шесть разных преступлений, которые нужно раскрыть.
Преступления которые нужно раскрыть Шерлоку, интересные и запутаные и если с первого взгляда кажется, что убийца найден, то чем чательней проводишь расследование, тем больше открывается новых улик и мотив у преступлений уже совершенно другой, чем вам казалось час назад.
Не смотря на свою среднию продолжительность 12-15 часов, эта игра сумеет завоевать ваше внимание и любовь, даже если вы и не любити детективный жанр.
Моя оценка ей - 9/10, так что, рекомендую всем.

16951404.review:
I was just in the mood for Sherlock one day and started reading the books as I had not read any of them since school. About a week after that I noticed this game on sale and I thought I'd give it a try..... Initially, I was a bit taken back by the minimalist approach but as the game went on it became something I not only understand but totally love. It has this "wide linear" feel about the whole game that keeps you focused on the task at hand while also giving you a relative amount of freedom. Definately a refreshing game if you have been playing "quick twitch, headshot, find next target" type games and want something different. Overall, this game is one that should not be missed by anyone who has read, watched, or listened any Sherlock Holmes related story before. Even if not, this game is a great entry point into Mr. Holmes and Dr. Watson's adventures.   

9/10

Loved the idea of multiple choice instead of all the clues leading to only one conclusion - this way you actually feel like you're being a real detective. I also liked the 3rd person control as opposed to the previous point and click.
To top it off, the graphics of this game are really beautifully detailed.
The seperate cases well all fun and very diverse.

16942327.review:
Прошел предыдущую часть Шерлока от этих же разработчиков. В ней был шикарный сюжет и хороший геймплей. в Crimes and Punishments геймплей был изменен и доработан и сделано это на высшем уровне. Играть стало куда намного удобнее и приятнее. Интерфейс дедукции полностью переработан и стал интереснее. Графика и детализация так же на высоте. Во время переходов между локациями во время загрузок вы можете не просто ждать, а продолжать расследования читая об уликах, персонажах и тп в журнале расследований либо составляя звенья в дедукции. Игра состоит из 6ти не связанных между собой дел. Именно от вас зависит будет ли наказан убийца и какой приговор он получит. Также вы можете неверно расскрыть дело и наказать невиновного, от чего расследовать каждое дело становится намного интереснее, некая нелинейность.
Из минусов: простые головоломки (в предыдущей части были куда труднее и поинтереснее), есть дела слишком очевидные и вариантов возможного расскрытия дела мало, например последняя миссия, в которой всего лишь 3 варианта исхода. Хотя процесс расскрытия и сюжет дела все равно интересный и затягивающий.
В целом игра очень радует. Определенно стоит своих денег и заслуживает продолжения. Надеюсь оно будет.
Оценка: 8/10

16897236.review:
Really excellent game. For me, it captured the fun of being Sherlock Holmes and the essence of a Victorian setting. The game lets you explore the maps and draw your own conclusions. It's a lot of fun to look for clues and make deductions.

You shouldn't consider this game to be a real mental challenge, there's a lot of hand-holding, but that's not a bad thing. Sometimes I get stuck in these puzzle games on the most obscure clue and it's infuriating. The same goes for the mini-games, they're not very hard either but an appropriate level of fun (and you can always skip them). In an age where I've got like 10 unplayed games in my Steam library, I don't really feel like taking a lot of time to click the mouse in the *exact* right position or whatever.

The graphics are really great too, and you can really tell that the devs put in a phenomenal effort to make a great game. There is a lot of depth here that you may not always expect.
